comment: Overall, this is one of the hardest classes I've ever taken, but I learned a lot and I respect Dr. Mallavarapu's style of grading. Only three exams and one optional final (all on respondus lockdown). There is a five question quiz once a week on lockdown which made the class difficult. 5 questions doesn't give a good margin of error so study often!

The professor seems nice but she is a tough grader. She has 5 question quizzes once a week. Her exams and APA assignments are difficult. If you don't know APA format like a pro, don't take this professor. Her feedback is not helpful and her lessons aren't easy to understand. This is not an easy going class and I would not take her again.

Dr. M was a good professor but her class is very lecture heavy! Majority of the learning is through PowerPoints looked over in class and it can get quite boring but if you're interested enough in the class it's not TOO bad. Test and Quizzes are lockdown but she provides study guides and they're not hard if you pay attention in class!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Lecture heavy

comment: She is a really tough grader. The content itself is sort of easy but that doesn't reflect on my grade. If you put in the work, you could probably manage a B. She is very picky about APA so you better know that manual like the back of your hand.

The overall course-load is regular, but she only tells you certain assignments a week before their due date which frustrated me as this is an online course. You also MUST read the book or else you will fail.

I took Dr. M for my internship capstone class, and I loved her. She always emailed me back when I had questions and always stayed in contact with the students. She was really understanding and nice. She's a great choice for the capstone.

Professor Mallavarapu really managed to make me hate learning about research for psychology. She makes everything painfully difficult, and isnt thorough in her explanations. Choose any other professor if you still want to love psychology.

This teacher was one of the most un-empathetic teachers ive ever come across, especially during a pandemic. She doesn't care about whats going on in your personal life, so if you have any kind of emergency, no leniency. She is a tough grader. 10/10 would not take again
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: It doesn't give clear instructions. I even had a grad student at the writer's center to get confused about her assignment. Also, she adds points because half the class missed at least 4-6 questions on all 3 exams. That means, the questions were poorly asked. Don't take her online! Maybe on campus would have been different.

Dr. M is a wonderful prof! .She answers questions thoroughly and her feedback is extremely helpful. Her in-class activities helps a lot on the tests and if you read the text book you'll do good on tests. Theres a quiz every week but if you read youll be fine. Not an easy A but if you want to actually learn definitely take her!

Dr. M's class isn't extremely difficult, however, she's not the most easiest grader. Nearly everyone in class made 70s. Our exam averages are almost always in the 70s. If you have a concern she doesn't really try addressing it to help, but more so just so she can say she has addressed it. Takes a while to respond to emails. I do not recommend.

Do not take her class. She always has to be right and will not see anyone else's point of view. She grades everything very harshly and can almost never receive a good grade on anything besides her tests if you try hard enough. I refuse to take her class again.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: Do not take her class. She is not a good teacher at all unless you are a teacher's pet. Reading the book does not help because at the end of the day what she says goes and its always something different. She gives a quiz every week before she teaches the material so you have to read and takes it for a grade.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: If you're good at teaching yourself then this is the class for you. She mostly requires that you read the textbook, but then, if you go to class she does activities that do not help. She does not explain the material that much so things can get confusing. She always thinks she is right and makes quiz/ test questions confusing.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: She always made lectures fun and we even had interactive activities in class demonstrating concepts we were learning. For the tests I read over my notes and did fine. Easy A and we didn't use the textbook much
Nice professor. Her lectures were long and boring however the tests were straight forward.

She was just okay. Really nice & willing to help, but lectures are very long and boring. Quiz every week. 4 tests, each has 1-2 essays that have to be around a page long, so you need to write out all of the possible essays she gives you in order to be prepared for the one she picks, which is stressful. Tests aren't too hard otherwise.
Professor M was one of the best professors Ive had at Kennesaw. Her PowerPoints are very helpful along with all of her concept checks. Tests are fair.

Dr. Mallavarapu's class was very clear with grading. However, there are quizzes every week so be prepared to study. The tests usually have essay questions that are worth 20 points, but she gives you a study guide beforehand so you know what to prepare for.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: Probably one of the sweetest professors I've ever had. Shes very smart and will help you with any questions you may have after class. Lecture sometimes drag but if you're interested in Psych you'll enjoy it. The MC tests are really the only grades and can be difficult if you don't take the class seriously but if you pay attention you'll do well.

Her tests aren't too bad, and she's great about quickly grading things and handing them back, but the lectures are dull af and difficult to follow. She isn't terribly engaging, and it doesn't help that she zips through them and tells students to finish taking notes at home. I like her, but I would avoid taking her again because of the lecture style
Long lectures, but its a psych class so it was expected. Tests are all multiple choice... all you need to do is study.

Dr. M is a really great professor-- you don't need the textbook because her slides are based off them and she puts them online. She also gives 6 tests to try to break up the info and will do review games that are actually really helpful. Didn't have a single hw assignment and one of the test was open note.

6 tests, some (easy) hw, she makes the class interesting on some days. if you read over the PPs/do the online hw, you are sure to pass. I get B's on every test& I'm not good at studying but I had to read over her PP's to do good on test. I study everything right before the test and I did okay every time. willing to help &open to answering questions

Best prof I've ever had! Requires more effort than most classes, but you will retain the material long past the class. She's approachable, kind, and easily accessible. Key to an A: read prior to class, print the slides to follow along, start assignments early, utilize office hours for feedback oppurtunities (especially the final lit review).
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Dr. M was one of the best teachers I've ever had!! She really breaks down the material and wants everyone in class to succeed. There are 3 article summaries and a final lit review that are very difficult- but she will help you if you meet with her. She gives study guides and the quizzes help prepare you for the exam.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: She's the most adorable professor at KSU. As long as you read over the slides, you will get an A. The material is not too confusing and she really cares about her students so she takes the time to make sure you are well prepared. There is one easy term paper that she give you lots of feedback on, and 10 quizzes but she drops the lowest one.

Her tests are a total beast, but she's fairly clear in her explanations and is always attentive to the class's needs. She is very tough but fair, and if the class  feels unsure on a quiz or doesn't have enough time to do a lit review, she'll work with the class on that. She moves through slides too fast. Read the book, it helps.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: I've taken a few classes with Dr. M and I love her. She is extremely helpful and clear. She will make sure everyone understands before moving on. This class includes tests, scheduled quizzes, a few participation grades, and a paper. She is extremely clear on what is going to be on tests and quizzes.

Dr. M is probably one of the kindest teachers. 2300 is a tough class but she does everything she can to make sure students are performing at their best. There are 4 tests, class assignments that help your grade, 3 small lit reviews, and 1 large lit review worth a test grade. The tests and lit reviews get easier as you progress through the semester because she gives great feedback! I have a high B right now in the class.

Dr M is a great teacher. She is clear about what she expects and very willing to help. She is a relentlessly tough grader. If your an A student with perfect writing youll do great. If your not the perfect A student you will struggle. While she might be helpful shes very tough on grading. Dont be fooled a LOT of the students struggled.

Amazing- helpful, easy, & kind! Go to class, do the assignments, & study her PPTS (online)/study guides for the tests & you'll pass with flying colors. She makes this class easy for you & is willing to work with you. 4 tests, 10 quizzes, 3 short papers, & one term paper. She tells you exactly what she wants for the papers & what is on the quizzes.

I highly recommend Dr. M! Tells you when the quizzes are and what's on them. Hardest thing were the summaries- she grades harder on the questions than the actual summary. More than happy to meet with you and help you. Attend all lab days- they help SO much. TAKE HER.

She is a fabulous professor for research methods. She is very clear what is going to be on the quizes and extremely helpful if you do not understand a concept. She continuously reminds us what is do and makes sure that we understand it. Do not skip her class because it is a lot of information and you need to know it. Tests are not that bad.

Dr. M is a great professor, she provides powerpoints of material covered in class, but goes into more detail during class time, GO. Tests are a little tough, definitely need to prepare! No studying the night before. The summaries are probably the most frustrating part and the Lit review. Go to class. Study. Work hard. And pay attention to writing.

This class wasn't extremely tough but her lectures were very confusing and there is a lot of information. She does put them on d2l though. Tests were pretty hard and after 3 absences she drops you a whole letter grade. You definitely have to study and come to class
Her teaching style does not match her testing style. You can't just study the material, you need to know examples. Her tests are all interpretation.
Nice teacher great at explaining things. Strict with attendance. There is homework but the answers are in the powerpoints.

Great Great GREAT Professor! Really knows what she's teaching, good powerpoints and easy multiple choice tests. Not much homework at all, test about every week but only takes 10 minutes. Posts all slides to D2L and uses videos in class. One of best professors I've had at KSU.
I loved her! She was able to grab your attention and made class fun and interesting.

Dr. M is seriously great. She teaches mostly upper level courses so yes, there is usually more work involved. In L+B, we had so many quizzes but honestly, they boosted my grade. Her lectures aren't very interesting but she gives you the notes and the material is pretty instinctual. I love Dr. M and I would definitely take her again and plan to!

Anyone saying that she is a hard professor most likely never took notes or never studied this isn't high school, you actually have to study. Dr. M is such an amazing professor and really sparked my interest in psychology. She tries to make it as clear as possible.  Her tests came straight from the ppts and videos she shows in class. TAKE HER

Dr. M is very good at lecturing, but you must pay attention and come to class. She uses lots of slides and provides them for you, so you do not need to take notes but participate in class. She gives study guides for tests but does not do a review day. You must study but she is so helpful.
this class was very hard! I withdrew.
She is a good professor and she teaches through examples, which is helpful for the test. All tests are multiple choice and notes are on D2L so you can study right from the notes.

I took her last semester and am currently enrolled in Experimental. Experimental sucks no matter what, but Dr. M helps you be prepared for it. I would not hesitate in taking Dr. M again. Good luck. Study for her quizzes and know the material. By doing that, you will be prepared for the exams. Not as easy as that, but don't make it harder.

Professor M is a great teacher! Her teaching style is easy to learn after the first exam. You don't need to buy the book because the powerpoints will give you the info. You will have to know all small details on the pwpts though. Other than that, wording with Dr. M can be confusing and you will have quizzes every wednesday over weekly reading.

Dr. M is a great professor. Take her! She will definitely prepare you for 3301. She is extremely helpful and fair. The class itself is tough because it's meant to be, but she cares about her students. I love her teaching style and highly suggest you take her. Drops lowest quiz. Quizes prepare you for the exams. Study for quizes and ur ready 4 exams
Dr. M. was actually a decent professor. The class was not as hard as others would lead you to believe.  In my opinion Careers in Psyc is more difficult than Research Methods with Dr. M.

She is a really difficult teacher. She even said herself that her multiple choice tests are hard and she was laughing about it. Too much information to remember for an intro class. Do not take this class unless you are ready to study every single day.

I really enjoyed her class and learned a lot, but it is not an easy class. She gives a lot of quizzes, which helps studying the material before the test. The research project is a pain in the neck!!! be wise to chose your partner because is a lot of work and she is EXTREMELY strict.
Tests come straight from powerpoints. Interesting class and fairly easy if you study. Don't buy textbook.

Dr.M seems understanding and wanting to help and she is when it comes to class material/lectures but when it comes to the full on research project you have to do...worst professor.Really strict on tardiness; marked absent if you pass a certain time. possibly the worst at dealing with group issues which you will prob have unless you're lucky!

Dr. M is a great professor! She makes Research Methods seem like a piece of cake! She is very kind, and makes all of her instructions and expectations crystal clear. I would highly recommend her for Research Methods or any other class she teachers.

GREAT TEACHER!! Research in not an easy class to begin with, but Dr. M makes it understandable and is always willing to explain things more or help someone who doesn't understand. Attendance is a must. I would absolutely take her again! to reiterate.... GREAT TEACHER!!!

This is a difficult class and I thought she taught very well. Take her if you get the chance. She does everything she can to help students understand. There are 8 scheduled quizzes and 3 tests, all are very fair. I wish she were teaching experimental.

To pass this class you must come to class and study your notes. can only miss three days or u drop a letter grade. just do the study guides before the test, it helps alot. Dr. Suma isnt the best, she is dull, but the class is easy if you try.

Very good teacher. She knows the subject well and is very pasionate about it. Every 1101 psyc class has ALOT of material, but she does a great job of explaining it in great detail. She gives you extensive study guide before each test or quiz. Attend class (attendance is graded) and pay attention!

Every Gen'l psyc course will have A LOT of material to cover. But Dr. Suma does a swell job of explaining everything. Something about how she taught the class made me more eager to learn the information. Very organized and fair. Strangely calm for a pregnany woman. I definitely plan on taking her again for some of my future psyc courses!

She is very straight forward with what you will need to study for her tests. Towards the end of the semester she even told us the number of questions from each chapter that will be asked on the exam. To make an A, go to class, pay attention,and study outside of class consistantly. What a concept- clearly not one that the negative commmenters grasp

Terrible class. I was an A/B student is high school and have passed very few assignments this semester. Tests are ridiculous. I dont know where she gets her questions or answers. This question was pulled straight from her test. . . "Based on answers B, C, or D which one  is correct. The answer was A. Her class is terrible along with her teaching.

Tests are hard so know material! She is a very boring professor for such an interesting subject. I went to almost every class and still got a C because she covered a ton of material and she made it pretty confusing. The book will help and she gives quizzes that are not too hard. Go to every class because she pops up graded assignments all the time.

She was SO hard! Her multiple choice answers cause you to second guess yourself, and it's almost as if there was no point in studying. She's not very clear with explanations. I would recommend to not take this class.

Good teacher. helps students to the best of her knowledge. you have to work for your grade. material can get tough but she explains it in a way that makes it pretty easy to understand. If you go to class and do your work you will do well in this class.

Dr. Mallavarapu or Dr. Suma really cares about the subject. She is very nice and helpful for the most part. I missed class and a quiz...I emailed her the day of to tell her I had a Doctor's note and she allowed me to make up the quiz. She is very particular about definitions, math problems, and a huge project. Study hard and you will succed.

This class was interesting and relatively easy if you are someone who actually studies for tests. Definitely use the study guides she gives you because that is pretty much the exam! The class wasn't hard; it just required actual effort which is refreshing. Dr. Suma is passionate about her field and definitely knows her stuff, I would recommend her!

The class requires a lot of studying and attending class helps tremendously! Detailed notes and study guides are always posted on time. If you are a slacker don't take this class, it requires many hours of studying. But she is WONDERFUL and always helpful. All psych majors should take Dr. Suma.

Dr. Mallavarapu wants her students to do well, and is willing to help. She is a new teacher, and I think some experience will make her a better educator. She had a couple of really rude students this semester, but she dealt with them tactfully.

This class is purely memorization. Use her study guide and pp notes and you'll succeed in her class. She gives 10 quizes,several brief in-class assignments, and 4 exams (ENTIRELY based on the notes) during the semester. The textbook is not necessary.

Dr. Mallavarapu was great!  She is extremely helpful.  She wants her students to succeed.  She provides a lot of powerpoints to help with study and lots of practice with quizzes and in class work.  Considering the Research Methods class should really be 2 sep. classes she does a great job with it.  Would definately take her again!

Suma is extremely dry with remnants of a middle-eastern accent. Sad, considering that she is a younger professor. Tests are relatively straight-forward with a few weird interpretations of definitions. In Research Strategies, all calculations are done old-school by hand, even though we can all do the tasks in 3 buttons of a TI-83. Dry, but bearable.
